qas.question: Which ideologies did the Soviet Union aspire to lead around the globe?
Which Soviet leader formed doctrine aimed at keeping socialist satellite nations in line?
The Soviet Union feared invasion from which potential enemy?
Who wanted to dominate Western and Eastern Europe?
Which country wanted to define socialism and liberalism?
Who feared invasion from Eastern Europe?
Which doctrine aimed against keeping socialist satellite nations in line?

context: The strategy behind the formation of the Warsaw Pact was driven by the desire of the <b3_0>Soviet Union<b3_0/> to dominate Central and Eastern Europe. This policy was driven by ideological and geostrategic reasons. Ideologically, the <b4_0>Soviet Union<b4_0/> arrogated the right to define <a0_0>socialism and communism<a0_0/> and act as the leader of the global socialist movement. A corollary to this idea was the necessity of intervention if a country appeared to be violating core socialist ideas and Communist Party functions, which was explicitly stated in the <a1_0><b6_0>Brezhnev<b6_0/><a1_0/> Doctrine. Geostrategic principles also drove the <b5_0>Soviet Union<b5_0/> to prevent invasion of its territory by <a2_0>Western Europe<a2_0/>an powers.
